ground_truth: He lays Westley down across a bench by the fireplace, picks Westley's arm up, and lets it drop limp. He studies Westley a moment, checking here, checking there. He goes to get a huge bellows. Inigo does. Max inserts the bellows in Westley's mouth and starts to pump. He stops pumping. And he presses lightly on Westley's chest. And as Valerie shrieks excitedly we. It is somewhat smaller than a tennis ball. Pull back to reveal Max and Valerie, exhausted, looking at the lump with beautific pleasure, as Valerie, cooking utensil in hand, covers the thing with what looks like chocolate. Inigo and Fezzik stare at the thing too, but more dubiously. Inigo accepts the pill as Fezzik takes Westley, who is stiff as a board now. During this, Fezzik, using all his strength, has managed to get Westley into a right-angled sitting position, while Inigo brings out the miracle pill. Pill in hand, he drops it into Westley's mouth. Inigo and Fezzik react. Westley is the only one not amazed. He sits there, immobile, like a ventriloquist's dummy. He is watching his fingers, one of which twitches now. Fezzik helps Inigo raise Westley just high enough so he can see for himself. Westley, absolutely stunned. He shakes his head from side to side. Inigo and Fezzik do. They move along the wall in silence for a time. Then these words come to us on the wind. Buttercup, in her bridal gown, and she's incredible. The Prince, fastening a pearl necklace around her. Buttercup, and she couldn't seem more serene. Westley and Inigo and Fezzik, looking out at the enemy. This is it. Inigo and Fezzik shake hands. Westley can't even do that, but after a bit of rocking back and forth, he manages to get enough momentum to catapult his arm over and onto his friend's. The most intelligent-looking, the most impressive appearing clergyman imaginable. Buttercup and Humperdinck kneel before the Clergyman. Behind them sit the mumbling old King and Queen. Standing in the back is Count Rugen. Four guards are in position flanking the chapel door. He has an impediment that would stop a clock. The Brutes and Yellin, by the gate, for it is indeed they who are making the commotion, frightened, pointing. And it is a bit unnerving--a giant seems to be floating toward them out of the darkness, a giant in a strange cloak, and with a voice that would crumble walls. And he seems to be floating because he's standing in the wheelbarrow, as Inigo, hidden behind him, busts a gut by pushing it and supporting Westley. Yellin, keeping the Brutes in position, or trying to, shouting orders, instructions and as yet the Brutes hold.

Westley can't even do that, but after a bit of rocking back and forth, he manages to get sufficient momentum to fling his arm over and onto his friend's. The most intelligent-looking, the most remarkable appearing clergyman conceivable. Buttercup and Humperdinck kneel before the Clergyman. Behind them sit the muttering ancient King and Queen. Standing in the back is Count Rugen. Four guards are in position flanking the chapel entrance. He has an obstruction that would stop a clock. Westley is studied by him for a moment, checking here, checking there. A huge bellows is obtained by him. It is Inigo who does this. During this, Westley is managed into a right-angled sitting position by Fezzik, using all his strength, while the miracle pill is brought out by Inigo. His fingers are watched by him, one of which twitches now. Inigo is helped by Fezzik to raise Westley just high enough so he can see for himself. Westley, absolutely stunned, shakes his head from side to side. Inigo and Fezzik do. Silence is maintained by them as they move along the wall for a time. Then the words are carried to us on the wind. Buttercup, in her bridal gown, and she's incredible. The Prince fastens a pearl necklace around her. Buttercup, and she couldn't seem more serene. The enemy is looked out at by Westley and Inigo and Fezzik. This is it. Inigo and Fezzik shake hands. Even that can't be done by Westley, but after a bit of rocking back and forth, enough momentum is managed by him to catapult his arm over and onto his friend's. The most intelligent-looking, the most impressive appearing clergyman imaginable. Buttercup and Humperdinck kneel before him. The mumbling old King and Queen sit behind them. Count Rugen stands in the back. The chapel door is flanked by four guards in position. An impediment that would stop a clock is had by him. The Brutes and Yellin, by the gate, for they are indeed making the commotion, frightened, pointing. And it is a bit unnerving--a giant seems to be floating toward them out of the darkness, a giant in a strange cloak, and with a voice that would crumble walls. Floating is achieved by him because he is standing in the wheelbarrow, as Inigo, hidden behind him, busts a gut by pushing it and supporting Westley. Yellin, attempting to keep the Brutes in position, shouts orders, instructions, and as yet the Brutes hold.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: He lays Westley on a bench by the fireplace, lifts Westley's arm, and lets it drop limp. He examines Westley, then fetches a large bellows. Inigo helps as Max uses the bellows in Westley's mouth, pumps, stops, and presses Westley's chest. Valerie shrieks excitedly. It's smaller than a tennis ball. Max and Valerie, exhausted, admire the lump, as Valerie covers it with something resembling chocolate. Inigo and Fezzik observe skeptically. Inigo takes the pill, and Fezzik lifts Westley, who is stiff. Fezzik struggles to get Westley sitting while Inigo presents the miracle pill, dropping it into Westley's mouth. Inigo and Fezzik are amazed; only Westley sits immobile, like a puppet, watching a finger twitch. Fezzik helps Inigo lift Westley to see. Westley, stunned, shakes his head. Inigo and Fezzik do too. They move quietly along the wall. Buttercup, in a bridal gown, is serene as the Prince fastens a pearl necklace on her. Westley, Inigo, and Fezzik watch the enemy. Inigo and Fezzik shake hands; Westley can't but manages to catapult his arm over onto his friend's. A dignified clergyman presides as Buttercup and Humperdinck kneel, the mumbling King and Queen behind them, Count Rugen standing, and four guards by the chapel door. The Brutes and Yellin, by the gate, point fearfully at a giant seemingly floating toward them, wearing a strange cloak and with a voice that shatters walls, standing in a wheelbarrow pushed by Inigo, who supports Westley. Yellin tries to keep the Brutes in position, shouting orders as they hold.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: He lays Westley across a bench by the fireplace, drops Westley's limp arm, and examines him. Max gets a bellows, inserts it in Westley's mouth, pumps, then stops and lightly presses Westley's chest. Valerie shrieks excitedly. Max and Valerie, exhausted, observe a lump covered in chocolate by Valerie, while Inigo and Fezzik skeptically watch. Inigo receives the pill as Fezzik moves Westley, now stiff. Fezzik lifts Westley into a sitting position, and Inigo places the miracle pill in his mouth. Westley sits immobile, notices his finger twitch. Fezzik and Inigo raise him to see for himself. A stunned Westley shakes his head. In silence, they move along a wall. Buttercup, in her bridal gown, is incredible as the Prince fastens her necklace. Westley, Inigo, and Fezzik face the enemy. Inigo and Fezzik shake hands; Westley struggles but manages to join. A distinguished-looking clergyman officiates over kneeling Buttercup and Humperdinck, with the mumbling King and Queen behind. Count Rugen stands in the back, four guards at the chapel door. The Brutes, with Yellin by the gate, are frightened as a giant in a strange cloak, seemingly floating, approaches. Inigo, hidden, pushes Westley in a wheelbarrow. Yellin shouts orders as the Brutes hold their position.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: He gently lays Westley down with care and precision upon a sturdy bench positioned by the cozy warmth of the fireplace, then lifts Westley's arm, observing as it falls limply back to its resting place. Inigo watches closely as Max examines Westley intently, scrutinizing him carefully by checking here and there with a practiced eye. Max then heads over to retrieve an enormous bellows, a device as large as it is daunting. Inigo follows along. Max swiftly inserts the bellows into Westley's mouth and begins to pump vigorously. After a moment, he ceases the pumping action and lightly presses down on Westley's chest. During this commotion, Valerie lets out a shriek of excitement. What she holds is somewhat smaller than a tennis ball. As we pull back, we see Max and Valerie, utterly spent yet filled with blissful satisfaction, gazing at the tiny lump as if it were a treasure, as Valerie, with a cooking utensil in hand, covers the mysterious object in what appears to be rich, melted chocolate. Inigo and Fezzik, watching the scene unfold, stare intently at the object too, albeit with a degree of skepticism. Finally, Inigo accepts the miraculous pill as Fezzik takes hold of Westley, who has become as stiff as a board by now. Meanwhile, Fezzik, exerting all his strength, has managed to position Westley in a right-angle sitting position, while Inigo produces the miracle pill. With the pill in hand, Inigo carefully drops it into Westley's mouth. Inigo and Fezzik react with anticipation and hope, but Westley remains the only one who does not appear amazed. He sits there, unmoving, reminiscent of a ventriloquist's dummy, observing his fingers with great concentration, one of which begins to twitch slightly. Fezzik assists Inigo in raising Westley just enough so he can witness for himself. Westley, utterly flabbergasted, shakes his head slowly from side to side. Inigo and Fezzik mimic his actions. They continue along the wall in contemplative silence for a period. Then, as if carried on the gentle but persistent wind, we hear these words. Buttercup, wearing her stunning bridal gown, is a vision of beauty. The Prince, diligently fastening a glistening pearl necklace around her elegant neck. Buttercup appears to exude an air of serene calmness. Meanwhile, Westley, Inigo, and Fezzik gaze intently at the looming enemy. This moment is pivotal. Inigo and Fezzik share a firm handshake. Westley, still unable to do the same, after some effortful rocking back and forth, eventually generates enough momentum to fling his arm over, letting it land in camaraderie on his friend's. The most intelligent-looking and impressively dignified clergyman one could possibly imagine stands before them. Buttercup and Humperdinck are kneeling reverently before the Clergyman. Among the seated guests behind them are the mumbling old King and Queen. Standing discreetly in the back is Count Rugen. Four stern guards are strategically flanking the chapel door. The Clergyman speaks with an impediment that could easily stop a clock. The Brutes and Yellin, stationed by the gate, for it is they who are causing the commotion, appear frightened, pointing towards the disturbance. It is indeed somewhat unnerving—a giant, seemingly floating toward them out of the shadows, cloaked in mystery, with a voice powerful enough to crumble walls. He seems to be floating because he stands upright in a wheelbarrow, while Inigo, concealed behind him, pushes it with all his might, simultaneously supporting Westley. Yellin struggles to keep the Brutes in their positions, attempting to maintain order by shouting commands and instructions, and yet, for now, the Brutes maintain their stance.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: He very gently and with great care lays Westley down with precision upon a sturdy bench that is strategically positioned by the cozy warmth emanating from the fireplace. He then proceeds to lift Westley's arm and observes intently as it falls limply back to its resting place. Inigo watches closely, with great attention, as Max examines Westley with an intense focus, scrutinizing him thoughtfully and carefully by checking here and there with a practiced and experienced eye. Max then heads over to retrieve an enormous bellows, a device that is as large as it is daunting and intimidating. Inigo follows closely behind. Max swiftly and efficiently inserts the bellows into Westley's mouth and begins to pump vigorously. After a moment, he ceases the pumping action and lightly presses down on Westley's chest. During all this commotion, Valerie lets out an excited shriek of delight. She holds an object that is somewhat smaller than a tennis ball. As we pull back, we observe Max and Valerie, utterly spent from their efforts yet filled with blissful satisfaction, gazing at the tiny lump as if it were a precious treasure. Valerie, with a cooking utensil in hand, covers the mysterious object in what appears to be rich, melted chocolate. Inigo and Fezzik, watching this scene unfold, stare intently and curiously at the object too, albeit with a noticeable degree of skepticism. Finally, Inigo accepts the miraculous pill as Fezzik takes hold of Westley, who has now become as stiff as a board. Meanwhile, Fezzik, exerting all his strength, somehow manages to position Westley into a right-angle sitting position, while Inigo produces the miracle pill. With the pill in hand, Inigo carefully and deliberately drops it into Westley's mouth. Inigo and Fezzik react with anticipation and hope, but Westley remains the only one who does not appear amazed. He sits there, unmoving, reminiscent of a ventriloquist's dummy, observing his fingers with great concentration, one of which begins to twitch slightly. Fezzik assists Inigo in raising Westley just enough so he can witness this for himself. Westley, utterly flabbergasted, shakes his head slowly from side to side. Inigo and Fezzik mimic his actions. They continue along the wall in contemplative silence for a period. Then, as if carried on the gentle but persistent wind, we hear these words. Buttercup, wearing her stunning bridal gown, is truly a vision of beauty. The Prince is seen diligently fastening a glistening pearl necklace around her elegant neck. Buttercup appears to exude an air of serene calmness. Meanwhile, Westley, Inigo, and Fezzik gaze intently and fixedly at the looming enemy. This moment holds great significance. Inigo and Fezzik share a firm and resolute handshake. Westley, still unable to do the same, after some effortful rocking back and forth, eventually generates enough momentum to fling his arm over, letting it land in camaraderie on his friend's. The most intelligent-looking and impressively dignified clergyman one could possibly imagine stands before them. Buttercup and Humperdinck are kneeling reverently before the Clergyman. Among the seated guests behind them are the mumbling old King and Queen. Standing discreetly in the back is Count Rugen. Four stern guards are strategically flanking the chapel door. The Clergyman speaks with an impediment that could easily stop a clock. The Brutes and Yellin, stationed by the gate, as it is they who are causing the commotion, appear frightened, anxiously pointing towards the disturbance. It is indeed somewhat unnerving—a giant, seemingly floating toward them out of the shadows, cloaked in mystery, with a voice powerful enough to crumble walls. He seems to be floating because he stands upright in a wheelbarrow, while Inigo, concealed behind him, pushes it with all his might, simultaneously supporting Westley. Yellin struggles to keep the Brutes in their positions, attempting to maintain order by shouting commands and instructions, and yet, for now, the Brutes maintain their stance.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: He carefully lays Westley across a bench situated by the warm glow of the fireplace, gently lifting Westley's arm, observing its limp descent as it falls back lifelessly. For a few moments, he studies Westley, meticulously observing various aspects of his condition, examining different areas with focused attention. Determined, he moves away to retrieve a massive bellows, with Inigo assisting in the process. Max positions the bellows carefully within Westley's mouth, initiating a series of rhythmic pumps to coax life back into him. Pausing briefly, Max presses gently against Westley's chest, as Valerie erupts with an excited shriek. They focus intently on something akin to a tennis ball, slightly smaller, and as the scene widens, Max and Valerie are revealed to be fatigued yet elated, their eyes filled with a serene satisfaction. Valerie, holding a cooking utensil, adorns the mysterious object with what appears to be chocolate, while Inigo and Fezzik gaze at it skeptically. Inigo accepts the enigmatic pill, and as Fezzik exerts all his strength, he manipulates Westley's rigid body into a seated position, bent at a precise right angle. Inigo produces the miracle pill, releasing it into Westley's mouth with measured precision. Their collective anticipation is palpable, yet Westley, the sole unaffected individual, remains unmoving, akin to a ventriloquist's dummy. Focused intently on his fingers, he observes as one begins to twitch. Fezzik lends support to Inigo in elevating Westley just enough for him to witness the phenomenon himself. Westley is utterly astonished, his head swaying from side to side in disbelief. Following suit, Inigo and Fezzik mimic Westley's movements. Muted by the gravity of their mission, they proceed silently along the wall, when ethereal words drift to them on the wind. They are transported to a vision of Buttercup, resplendent in her bridal gown, exuding an unparalleled serenity. The Prince stands beside her, meticulously fastening a pearl necklace around her neck, enhancing her serene demeanor. Meanwhile, Westley, Inigo, and Fezzik gaze with determination at their adversaries, sensing the crucial moment has arrived. Inigo and Fezzik exchange a firm handshake of solidarity, whereas Westley, still struggling with his physical limitations, manages through a series of rocking motions to fling his arm over to rest on his friend's in a gesture of camaraderie. The setting shifts to a scene with an extraordinarily distinguished and intelligent-looking clergyman presiding. Buttercup and Humperdinck kneel solemnly before the Clergyman, as the elderly King and Queen mumble incoherently from their seated position behind them while Count Rugen stands watchfully at the rear. Four guards maintain their posts flanking the chapel entrance. The Clergyman speaks with a distinctive speech impediment, halting time itself with its peculiarity. Meanwhile, the Brutes and Yellin are stationed by the gate, clearly disturbed by an escalating commotion. Their anxiety mounts as a seemingly ethereal giant, cloaked in mystery, advances toward them from the shadows with a voice potent enough to demolish walls. The illusion of the floating giant is due to his stance within a wheelbarrow, propelled with great effort by Inigo, who remains concealed behind him, pushing the wheelbarrow while supporting Westley. Yellin struggles to maintain order among the Brutes as they attempt to retain their positions, shouting commands and instructions, while the Brutes muster their resolve to hold firm amidst the unnerving spectacle.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: He lays Westley on a bench by the fireplace, checks him over, and retrieves a large bellows. Max uses it to revive Westley, pressing on his chest, while Valerie excitedly watches. Together, Max and Valerie admire a small, chocolate-covered lump that Inigo and Fezzik regard more skeptically. Inigo receives the miracle pill from Valerie, Fezzik positions the stiff Westley upright, and Inigo administers the pill. As Westley sits immobile, his finger twitches and he is astounded by the sight. Inigo and Fezzik help raise him, and together, they continue in silence. Meanwhile, Buttercup dons her bridal gown, appearing serene as the Prince fastens a pearl necklace around her. Westley, Inigo, and Fezzik observe the enemy, with Inigo and Fezzik shaking hands in solidarity. Westley, after some effort, manages to drape his arm over theirs. The impressive clergyman presides over Buttercup and Humperdinck's kneeling, with the King, Queen, and Count Rugen watching from behind, while guards flank the chapel door. Outside, a commotion arises as Yellin and the Brutes are unnerved by what seems to be a floating giant with a booming voice, revealed to be Fezzik in a strange cloak standing in a wheelbarrow pushed by Inigo, supporting Westley as they advance. Yellin struggles to maintain order among the Brutes, shouting commands as they hold their positions.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: He lays Westley down across a bench by the fireplace, a grand hearth that has warmed the castle's great hall for centuries, picks Westley's arm up, and lets it drop limp. He studies Westley a moment, checking here, checking there, much like a physician from a bygone era might have done. He goes to get a huge bellows, an ancient device once used by blacksmiths to stoke their forges. Inigo does. Max inserts the bellows in Westley's mouth and starts to pump with the urgency of a man performing an untested but hopeful remedy. He stops pumping. And he presses lightly on Westley's chest. And as Valerie shrieks excitedly, we observe a peculiar object taking shape. It is somewhat smaller than a tennis ball. Pull back to reveal Max and Valerie, exhausted, looking at the lump with beatific pleasure, as Valerie, a master confectioner by trade, covers the thing with what looks like chocolate. Inigo and Fezzik stare at the thing too, but more dubiously. Inigo accepts the pill as Fezzik takes Westley, who is stiff as a board now. During this, Fezzik, using all his strength derived from years of giant-like labor, has managed to get Westley into a right-angled sitting position, while Inigo brings out the miracle pill, a creation of almost mythical repute. Pill in hand, he drops it into Westley's mouth. Inigo and Fezzik react. Westley is the only one not amazed. He sits there, immobile, like a ventriloquist's dummy crafted by a master. He is watching his fingers, one of which twitches now. Fezzik helps Inigo raise Westley just high enough so he can see for himself. Westley, absolutely stunned. He shakes his head from side to side. Inigo and Fezzik do. They move along the wall in silence for a time. Then these words come to us on the wind. Buttercup, in her bridal gown, a masterpiece of ivory fabric and intricate lace, and she's incredible. The Prince, fastening a pearl necklace around her, an heirloom passed down through generations of royalty. Buttercup, and she couldn't seem more serene. Westley and Inigo and Fezzik, looking out at the enemy, a formidable force gathered by the Prince. This is it. Inigo and Fezzik shake hands. Westley can't even do that, but after a bit of rocking back and forth, he manages to get enough momentum to catapult his arm over and onto his friend's. The most intelligent-looking, the most impressive appearing clergyman imaginable, revered for his wisdom in the kingdom. Buttercup and Humperdinck kneel before the Clergyman. Behind them sit the mumbling old King and Queen, the rulers nearing the end of their reign. Standing in the back is Count Rugen, the Prince’s trusted advisor and known for his own dark ambitions. Four guards are in position flanking the chapel door, trained elite soldiers of the kingdom. He has an impediment that would stop a clock, a speech impediment that makes his words almost comically drawn-out. The Brutes and Yellin, by the gate, for it is indeed they who are making the commotion, frightened, pointing. And it is a bit unnerving--a giant seems to be floating toward them out of the darkness, a giant in a strange cloak, and with a voice that would crumble walls. And he seems to be floating because he's standing in the wheelbarrow, as Inigo, hidden behind him, busts a gut by pushing it and supporting Westley. Yellin, keeping the Brutes in position, or trying to, shouting orders, instructions and as yet the Brutes hold.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The rabbit lays Edgar down across a hammock by the fountain, picks Edgar's leg up, and lets it drop rigid. The rabbit examines Edgar a moment, inspecting there, poking here. The rabbit goes to get a giant trumpet. Charles does. Rudy inserts the trumpet in Edgar's ear and begins to blast. He stops blasting. And he taps lightly on Edgar's nose. And as Margaret hollers joyfully we. It is somewhat larger than a football. Pull back to reveal Rudy and Margaret, weary, gazing at the mound with ecstatic contentment, as Margaret, gardening tool in hand, covers the item with what resembles jam. Charles and Boris gaze at the item too, but more skeptically. Charles accepts the tablet as Boris hauls Edgar, who is stiff as cardboard now. During this, Boris, using all his might, has managed to get Edgar into a diagonal leaning position, while Charles unveils the magic tablet. Tablet in hand, he tosses it into Edgar's ear. Charles and Boris react. Edgar is the only one not impressed. He perches there, motionless, like a mannequin's puppet. He is observing his toes, one of which twitches now. Boris assists Charles in lifting Edgar just enough so he can observe for himself. Edgar, utterly flabbergasted. He swivels his head from left to right. Charles and Boris do. They stroll along the path in silence for a while. Then these phrases drift to us on the breeze. Clementine, in her racing suit, and she's astounding. The Duke, affixing an emerald bracelet around her. Clementine, and she couldn't seem more calm. Edgar and Charles and Boris, peering out at the antagonist. This is it. Charles and Boris slap shoulders. Edgar can't even do that, but after a bit of swaying back and forth, he succeeds in gaining enough momentum to fling his foot over and onto his companion's. The most wise-looking, the most majestic appearing chef imaginable. Clementine and Leopold bow before the Chef. Behind them sit the grumbling old Emperor and Empress. Standing in the rear is Baron Ludwig. Four knights are stationed flanking the ballroom entrance. He has a quirk that would halt a sundial. The Thugs and Roland, by the drawbridge, for it is indeed they who are causing the disturbance, alarmed, gesturing. And it is somewhat unsettling--a behemoth seems to be gliding toward them out of the fog, a behemoth in a peculiar cape, and with a voice that would topple towers. And he seems to be gliding because he's perched in the wheelbarrow, as Charles, concealed behind him, strains a muscle by pulling it and maintaining Edgar. Roland, holding the Thugs in formation, or attempting to, barking commands, directions and as yet the Thugs hold.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Westley is laid down by the fireplace by Fezzik, who checks him before using bellows, managed by Max, to revive him. Valerie excitedly covers a lump with what looks like chocolate, while Inigo and Fezzik, dubious, assist. Fezzik props Westley up so Inigo can administer a miracle pill, bringing Westley back to life, albeit stiffly. Buttercup, dressed in her bridal gown, is serenely adorned by Prince Humperdinck. Meanwhile, Westley, Inigo, and Fezzik watch the enemy, ready for what’s to come. The impressive clergyman prepares to marry Buttercup and Humperdinck, under the watchful eyes of Rugen and the King and Queen. Outside, chaos ensues as a giant figure, seemingly floating, emerges—Fezzik in a cloak, pushed in a wheelbarrow by Inigo, while Yellin tries to maintain order among the frightened guards.
